com.kintone.client

Class RecordClient

  • Object
    • RecordClient

  • public class RecordClient
extends Object
    A client that operates record APIs.

      • createCursor

        public String createCursor(long app,
                           List<String> fields,
                           String query)
        Creates a cursor so that large amount of records can be obtained from an App.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        fields - the field codes to be included in the response when using the Get Cursor API
        query - the query string that will specify what records will be responded when using the Get Cursor API
        Returns:
        the created cursor ID

      • deleteRecords

                          List<Long> recordIds)
        Deletes multiple records in an app.
        Parameters:
        app - the app ID
        recordIds - a list of record IDs that will be deleted

      • deleteRecords

        public void deleteRecords(long app,
                          List<Long> recordIds,
                          List<Long> revisions)
        Deletes multiple records in an app.
        Parameters:
        app - the app ID
        recordIds - a list of record IDs that will be deleted
        revisions - the expected revision numbers. The first id number will correspond to the first revision number in the list, the second id to the second revision number, and so on.

      • getRecordComments

        public List<PostedRecordComment> getRecordComments(long app,
                                                   long recordId)
        Retrieves multiple comments from a record in an app.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        recordId - the record ID
        Returns:
        a list of comments

      • getRecordComments

        public List<PostedRecordComment> getRecordComments(long app,
                                                   long recordId,
                                                   Order order,
                                                   Long offset,
                                                   Long limit)
        Retrieves multiple comments from a record in an app.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        recordId - the record ID
        order - the sort order of the Comment ID. Specifying Order.ASC will sort the comments in ascending order, and Order.DESC will sort the comments in descending order.
        offset - This skips the retrieval of the first number of comments.
        limit - the number of records to retrieve
        Returns:
        a list of comments. See PostedRecordComment

      • getRecordComments

        public GetRecordCommentsResponseBody getRecordComments(GetRecordCommentsRequest request)
        Retrieves multiple comments from a record in an app.
        Parameters:
        request - the request parameters. See GetRecordCommentsRequest
        Returns:
        the response data. See GetRecordCommentsResponseBody

      • getRecords

        public List<Record> getRecords(long app)
        Retrieves details of multiple records from an App.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        Returns:
        a list of records. See Record

      • getRecords

        public List<Record> getRecords(long app,
                               int limit,
                               long offset)
        Retrieves details of multiple records from an App.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        limit - the maximum number of records to be retrieved
        offset - This skips retrieving the first number of records.
        Returns:
        a list of records. See Record

      • getRecords

        public List<Record> getRecords(long app,
                               List<String> fields,
                               int limit,
                               long offset)
        Retrieves details of multiple records from an App.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        fields - the field codes to be included in the response. Ignoring this parameter will return all accessible fields that exist in the App.
        limit - the maximum number of records to be retrieved
        offset - This skips retrieving the first number of records.
        Returns:
        a list of records. See Record

      • getRecords

        public List<Record> getRecords(long app,
                               String query)
        Retrieves details of multiple records from an App by specifying a query string.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        query - the query string that specifies what records to include in the response
        Returns:
        a list of records. See Record

        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        fields - the field codes to be included in the response. Ignoring this parameter will return all accessible fields that exist in the App.
        query - the query string that specifies what records to include in the response
        Returns:

      • updateRecordAssignees

        public long updateRecordAssignees(long app,
                                  long recordId,
                                  List<String> assignees)
        Updates the Assignees of a record status, that was set with the Process Management feature.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        recordId - the record ID
        assignees - the user codes of the Assignee(s)
        Returns:
        the revision number of the record after updating the Assignees

      • updateRecordAssignees

        public UpdateRecordAssigneesResponseBody updateRecordAssignees(UpdateRecordAssigneesRequest request)

        Parameters:
        request - the request parameters. See UpdateRecordAssigneesRequest
        Returns:
        the response data. See UpdateRecordAssigneesResponseBody

      • updateRecords

                                          List<RecordForUpdate> records)
        Updates details of multiple records in an App, by specifying their record numbers, or their unique keys.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        records - a list of objects that include id/updateKey, revision and record objects
        Returns:
        a list of record revisions. See RecordRevision

      • updateRecordStatus

        public long updateRecordStatus(long app,
                               long recordId,
                               String action)
        Updates the Status of a record of an App, that was set with the Process Management feature.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        recordId - the record ID
        action - the Action name of the action to run
        Returns:
        the revision number of the record after updating the status

      • updateRecordStatus

        public long updateRecordStatus(long app,
                               long recordId,
                               String action,
                               String assignee)
        Updates the Status of a record of an App, that was set with the Process Management feature.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        recordId - the record ID
        action - the Action name of the action to run
        assignee - the next Assignee. Specify the Assignee's code.
        Returns:
        the revision number of the record after updating the status

      • updateRecordStatus

        public UpdateRecordStatusResponseBody updateRecordStatus(UpdateRecordStatusRequest request)
        Updates the Status of a record of an App, that was set with the Process Management feature.
        Parameters:
        request - the request parameters. See UpdateRecordStatusRequest
        Returns:
        the response data. See UpdateRecordStatusResponseBody

      • updateRecordStatuses

        public List<RecordRevision> updateRecordStatuses(long app,
                                                 List<StatusAction> statusActions)
        Updates the Statuses of multiple records of an App, that were set with the Process Management feature.
        Parameters:
        app - the App ID
        statusActions - a list including information of the status actions to proceed
        Returns:
        a list of record revisions. See RecordRevision

      • updateRecordStatuses

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the response data. See UpdateRecordStatusesResponseBody
